item.title: FTSE 100 Falls in Early Trade on Caution Ahead of Market-Moving Events
item.description: The FTSE 100 opened around 0.3% lower on caution ahead of a busy week which includes the U.K. spring budget on Wednesday, Thursday’s ECB meeting and Friday’s U.S. non-farm payrolls data.

item.title: Japan's Nikkei Tops 40000 for First Time
item.description: The climb was driven by greater corporate earnings and a surge in chip-related stocks, thanks to enthusiasm for beneficiaries of artificial intelligence.

item.title: Evonik to Cut 6% of Workforce
item.description: Evonik said it would cut up to 2,000 jobs by 2026, expecting cost reductions of around €400 million, after its fourth-quarter underlying earnings came in slightly below consensus forecasts.

item.title: Metal Prices Are Mixed as China Demand Stays Muted
item.description: Base metals struggled higher, as data from China showed that weekly inventories for metals continued to rise last week as demand remained sluggish.

item.title: Oil Rises After OPEC+ Extends Output Cuts
item.description: Oil futures were firmer in early European trade after OPEC+ agreed to extend voluntary production cuts of 2.2 million barrels a day through the second quarter of the year.

item.title: Dollar More Likely to Rise Ahead of Friday's U.S. Jobs Data
item.description: The dollar is more likely to rise ahead of Friday’s non-farm payrolls data, which are still forecast to show solid jobs growth and to keep markets expecting that U.S. interest rates won’t be cut before the summer, ING said.

item.title: Portuguese Bond Yields Rise After S&P Upgrade
item.description: Ten-year Portuguese government bond yields rose after S&P Global Ratings upgraded Portugal’s credit rating to A- from BBB+ with a stable outlook.

item.title: Henkel Warns of Weaker Sales Growth
item.description: Henkel forecast organic sales growth of 2%-4% this year, below 2023’s figure, with prices for materials expected to remain flat, while the translation of sales in foreign currencies should also weigh.

item.title: China Cancels Premier's Post-NPC Press Conference in Break With Tradition
item.description: China has canceled the press conference its premier holds at the conclusion of the annual “Two Sessions” meeting, ending a decadeslong tradition.

item.title: Wuxi Companies' Shares Rise on Receding Worries About Potential U.S. Sanctions
item.description: Shares of the Wuxi family of biotech and research companies listed both in Shanghai and Hong Kong rose sharply on receding worries about potential U.S. sanctions.

item.title: Li Auto Shares Fall After Recent Run-Up, MEGA Miss
item.description: Analysts attributed the selloff to profit-taking after big gains last week and some consumer disappointment with the Chinese electric-vehicle maker’s newest model.

item.title: Nvidia's Surge Stokes Talk of a Bubble
item.description: The chip maker’s meteoric advance has helped push the stock market to record highs. It also has some on Wall Street saying the “B word.”

item.title: Russia's Backdoor for Battlefield Goods From China: Central Asia
item.description: Trade routes through the region are increasingly important to Moscow’s efforts to thwart Western sanctions.

item.title: How China Is Churning Out EVs Faster Than Everyone Else
item.description: Riding China’s EV boom, upstart automakers have eclipsed foreign rivals to develop cars faster, push the boundaries of smart tech and swamp consumers with choice.

item.title: A Brutal Murder, a Young Detective and the Perilous Path to Justice in Ukraine
item.description: Despite wartime solidarity, violent crime is rising. As one city fell, police rushed to build a case on behalf of a shattered family.

item.title: The Skyrocketing Costs Driving Cheeseburger Prices Up---and Restaurant Owners Out
item.description: Escalating payroll costs and diners’ dwindling tolerance for higher checks are putting independent restaurants in a squeeze.

item.title: Gov. Newsom is staking his political capital on a multibillion-dollar ballot measure aimed at addressing mental illness, drug abuse and homelessness in California.
item.description: Gov. Newsom is staking his political capital on a multibillion-dollar ballot measure aimed at addressing mental illness, drug abuse and homelessness in California.

item.title: The rapid surge in Nvidia's stock price has some Wall Street professionals wondering whether the enthusiasm for AI-related shares is becoming a classic stock bubble.
item.description: The rapid surge in Nvidia’s stock price has some Wall Street professionals wondering whether the enthusiasm for AI-related shares is becoming a classic stock bubble.

item.title: Russian spies recorded Germany's air-force commander and his top officers discussing the possible delivery of Berlin's most powerful guided missiles to Ukraine.
item.description: Russian spies recorded Germany’s air-force commander and his top officers discussing the possible delivery of Berlin’s most powerful guided missiles to Ukraine.

item.title: Chinese electric-vehicle makers have eclipsed foreign rivals to develop cars faster, push the boundaries of smart tech and swamp consumers with choice.
item.description: Chinese electric-vehicle makers have eclipsed foreign rivals to develop cars faster, push the boundaries of smart tech and swamp consumers with choice.
